description: Sunlit Thai islands, turquoise seas and balmy breeze — a soundtrack for barefoot sunsets.

items.name: Phuket: For a Larger than Life experience
items.description: Ranked among the world's most popular destinations for splendid vacations, Phuket is located in the Andaman Sea in Southern Thailand. Stunning gold sand beaches, colorful shoreline, thrilling watersports, & cosy beach resorts in Phuket make it one of the best islands in Thailand. And then there are celebrity-chef restaurants and other cosmopolitan diversions that add to the glitz quotient of the popular Thai island.

items.name: Mu Koh Ang Thong Marine Park: The Bowl of Gold
Koh Pha Ngan: Where hedonists & hippies gather for Full Moon Parties
Mu Koh Phi Phi: For solo travelers and couples
items.description: Mu Koh Phi Phi is a group of islands in Thailand near Krabi where solo travelers pour in large numbers to relax or party on its splendid beaches. Though it is Phi Phi Don that is the largest & the only permanently inhabited island in the archipelago, it is Koh Phi Phi Lee that shot to fame after featuring in the 2000 movie “The Beach”. The recent years have seen the island group rebuild almost entirely post the Tsunami of 2004.

items.name: Koh Lanta: For snorkeling & scuba-diving enthusiasts
items.description: A mere 30-minutes' boat ride from the Krabi town takes you to the beautiful island of Koh Lanta Yai. There are a few other islands nearby that, together with Koh Lanta Yai, form the Lanta group of islands. Its beautiful beaches, world-class diving centres, massage parlours, sumptuous seafood, and friendly fishing villages are not to be missed.

items.name: Koh Kai: Chicken Island
items.description: Koh Kai, popularly known as the Chicken Island, is a part of the Poda islands in Thailand near Krabi. The island of verdant cliffs received the name of Chicken Island due to the large rock formation that resembles the head and the neck of a chicken.

items.name: Koh Tao: Scuba diving paradise people like to call the Turtle Island
items.description: There are primarily two types of travelers that you'll find on Koh Tao – those who want to do scuba diving and those who want to take a scuba diving course. Not that there isn't anything else to do. The island boasts of a vibrant nightlife, little sandy coves, and pretty lantern-lit restaurants. But it is one of the best and – thanks to the high competition – one of the cheapest places to take diving courses. In addition to the regular diving courses, there are advanced courses like night diving, wreck diving, shark diving, and Nitrox diving.

items.name: Koh Lipe: For the hopeless romantics
items.description: There are 51 islands between Thailand and Malaysia that make up the Tarutao Marine Park. Of these, Koh Lipe is the most popular destination. Its jaw-dropping beaches and views of sunrise & sunset are beyond compare.

items.name: Koh Si Chang: An archipelago 12 km off the Si Racha town near Pattaya
items.description: Suggested Read: Thinking About Thailand In April? Here's All To See & Do That Will Blow Your Mind!

items.name: Koh Kut: A lesser known wonder for the enthusiasts of water sports
Koh Tarutao: High-rise peaks of tropical rainforest
